org.aoplib4j.testing.internal
Class AbstractTestingAspect

java.lang.Object
  org.aoplib4j.testing.internal.AbstractTestingAspect
Direct Known Subclasses:
JUnitAspect, TestNGAspect
public abstract class AbstractTestingAspect
extends java.lang.Object

Abstract aspect representing the base for all the testing aspects. The basic idea is to intercept the execution of every tests and in every test to intercept all the assertion failures (if an assertion fail, the framework will intercept it and the test will continue to execute). The failures are stored and are thrown at the end of the test execution.

Author:
Adrian Citu

static final java.lang.String AOPLIB4J_FAIL_INHIBIT
System variable used for the tests to inhibit the fail of the test containing assertion failures. THIS VARIABLE SHOULD BE USED ONLY FOR/BY THE (our)UNIT TESTS.

executionOfTestMethodPointcut

public abstract void executionOfTestMethodPointcut()
Pointcut representing the execution of a test method. Every child aspect should write the pointcut proper to his own way of executing tests.

storeErrorInformation

final void storeErrorInformation(java.lang.Error error)
Store the error stack trace as a String into failedAssestionsStackTrace and updates by one the number of failed assertions.

Parameters:
error - the error thrown by the testing framework (TestNG, JUnit, etc).

Parameters:

Returns:

executionOfTestMethodAdvice

public final java.lang.Object executionOfTestMethodAdvice(org.aspectj.lang.ProceedingJoinPoint pjp)
                                                   throws java.lang.Throwable
Advice executed around (Around) the executionOfTestMethodPointcut() pointcut. The test is executed (using pjp.proceed()) and if there is no exception thrown then a verification of any assertion violation is done. If the test throws an exception (other than AssertionError which will be catch by assertCallAdvice(ProceedingJoinPoint)), the advice will catch it, will do a verification of any assertion violation and if none is violated then will thrown the initial exception.

Parameters:
pjp - aspectJ ProceedingJoinPoint
Returns:
the result of the join point execution (the test method).
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - necessary by the ProceedingJoinPoint.proceed()

checkTheAssertionViolation

private void checkTheAssertionViolation()
If the executed test had at least one failed assert then the method assertFail(String) is executed having as message all the previous failed assertions stack traces.

assertCallAdvice

public abstract void assertCallAdvice(org.aspectj.lang.ProceedingJoinPoint pjp)
                               throws java.lang.Throwable
Abstract method representing the advice for the assertCallPointcut(). Normally the child aspects should use the Around advice to implement the behavior arround the call of the assert methods.

Parameters:
pjp - object created by the AspectJ framework.
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - the exception that can be thrown.

assertFail

public abstract void assertFail(java.lang.String message)
Fails a test with the given message. Every child aspect should use the proper assert class or another mechanism to mark a test failure.

Parameters:
message - the assertion error message.
